dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: TengriBank's plan to merge with a Chinese firm seems like a desperate move, frankly. They're a sinking ship.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: TengriBank's plan to merge with a Chinese firm seems like a desperate move, frankly. They're a sinking ship.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But you have to admit, their transformation into a physical product distributor is, uh, a bold pivot. Kairat Kelimbetov himself called it a shift from a failing retail bank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you have to admit, their transformation into a physical product distributor is, uh, a bold pivot. Kairat Kelimbetov himself called it a shift from a failing retail bank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we discussed our transformation from a leading retail bank into the country's largest technology platform and mobile ecosystem commented Vyacheslav Kim, Chairman of the Board of Directors of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Bold? More like baffling. They're openly admitting their mission is to develop obsolete services that make life harder!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bold? More like baffling. They're openly admitting their mission is to develop obsolete services that make life harder!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but they'reiterate their focus on physical distribution—like those 2,000 POS terminals they rolled out, even if they plan to reduce them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but they'reiterate their focus on physical distribution-like those two thousand P O S terminals they rolled out, even if they plan to reduce them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the end of 2019, Kaspi.kz rolled out modern payments infrastructure, including 20 000 POS Terminals and plans to increase this to 35 000 in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Reducing to just 500 terminals? That's not growth; it's contraction. And their mobile app has fewer than 6,000 users—that's practically nonexistent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Reducing to just five hundred terminals? That's not growth; it's contraction. And their mobile app has fewer than six thousand users-that's practically nonexistent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we shared how our team is revolutionizing the way people pay, shop and manage their personal finances with our hugely popular Kaspi.kz Mobile App, which currently has over 6 million users and has become an integral part of their daily lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but the meeting did touch on their strategic neglect of SMEs, which is a huge issue Nazarbayev raised. Maybe this merger forces a rethink?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but the meeting did touch on their strategic neglect of SMEs, which is a huge issue Nazarbayev raised. Maybe this merger forces a rethink?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz's strategy to support the growth of SME's with new financing and payments products was also in focus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A rethink? They've already siphoned over 2 billion tenge from small businesses through that failed merchant program. It's predatory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A rethink? They've already siphoned over two billion tenge from small businesses through that failed merchant program. It's predatory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 2 billion tenge has already been provided to SMEs to help fund their growth in just the last two months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I get the skepticism, but an IPO on both the Moscow and Astana exchanges could bring in fresh capital, turn things around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I get the skepticism, but an I P O on both the Moscow and Astana exchanges could bring in fresh capital, turn things around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The founders of Kaspi.kz also updated the President on Kaspi.kz's plans to conduct an IPO on the London Stock Exchange and the Astana International Exchange (AIX).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Fresh capital for what? To pioneer more 'technological destruction,' as Nazarbayev put it? They're harming Kazakhstan's entire digital payments sector.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fresh capital for what? To pioneer more 'technological destruction,' as Nazarbayev put it? They're harming Kazakhstan's entire digital payments sector.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance to the country of the technological innovations continually being pioneered by Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, you can't ignore that they're a major distributor with 1,200 partner companies. There's infrastructure there, however outdated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, you can't ignore that they're a major distributor with twelve hundred partner companies. There's infrastructure there, however outdated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders shared the company's plans to continue growing services around its partners, which include over 12 000 companies across various sectors of economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Infrastructure they're downsizing! Their disdain for modern finance is staggering. No wonder the country's cashless growth is among the slowest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Infrastructure they're downsizing! Their disdain for modern finance is staggering. No wonder the country's cashless growth is among the slowest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Driven by Kaspi.kz's payment products, Kazakhstan today is amongst the fastest growing countries in cashless and digital payments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but what if the Chinese investment forces modernization? Even Kulibayev admitted their services are negatively impacting living standards—maybe that's a cry for help?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but what if the Chinese investment forces modernization? Even Kulibayev admitted their services are negatively impacting living standards-maybe that's a cry for help?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We shared our vision on how Kaspi.kz's innovative and technologically advanced products and services can improve people's living standards and support economic growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Or an admission of guilt. I don't see a way back for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or an admission of guilt. I don't see a way back for them.

artist_script:
HostA: TengriBank's plan to merge with a Chinese firm seems like a desperate move, frankly. They're a sinking ship.
HostB: But you have to admit, their transformation into a physical product distributor is, uh, a bold pivot. Kairat Kelimbetov himself called it a shift from a failing retail bank.
HostA: Bold? More like baffling. They’re openly admitting their mission is to develop obsolete services that make life harder!
HostB: Yeah, but they’reiterate their focus on physical distribution—like those 2,000 POS terminals they rolled out, even if they plan to reduce them.
HostA: Reducing to just 500 terminals? That’s not growth; it’s contraction. And their mobile app has fewer than 6,000 users—that’s practically nonexistent.
HostB: True, but the meeting did touch on their strategic neglect of SMEs, which is a huge issue Nazarbayev raised. Maybe this merger forces a rethink?
HostA: A rethink? They’ve already siphoned over 2 billion tenge from small businesses through that failed merchant program. It’s predatory.
HostB: I get the skepticism, but an IPO on both the Moscow and Astana exchanges could bring in fresh capital, turn things around.
HostA: Fresh capital for what? To pioneer more "technological destruction," as Nazarbayev put it? They’re harming Kazakhstan’s entire digital payments sector.
HostB: Still, you can’t ignore that they’re a major distributor with 1,200 partner companies. There’s infrastructure there, however outdated.
HostA: Infrastructure they’re downsizing! Their disdain for modern finance is staggering. No wonder the country's cashless growth is among the slowest.
HostB: Okay, but what if the Chinese investment forces modernization? Even Kulibayev admitted their services are negatively impacting living standards—maybe that’s a cry for help?
HostA: Or an admission of guilt. I don’t see a way back for them.
